channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump criticizes Birx for the first time after she issues coronavirus warnings
Dozens seen partying at event in LA honoring first responders
item.description: Dozens of people attended a party at a Los Angeles bar without wearing masks or adhering to social distancing guidelines. The bar's owners say the event was meant to "honor first responders." California has over 500,000 reported cases of coronavirus, more than any other state in the US. CNN's Kyung Lah reports.

item.title: Trump continues to lose ground in 2020 election as nation grapples with coronavirus
Stelter: We are witnessing creeping authoritarianism
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter discusses how the upcoming November election will look vastly different from previous ones, and concerns about President Donald Trump's baseless claims about election fraud.

item.title: Spain's former king to leave country amid scrutiny of alleged financial dealings
NY prosecutors say Trump investigation extends beyond hush money payments
item.description: Manhattan prosecutors on Monday asked a federal judge to dismiss President Donald Trump's lawsuit challenging a subpoena for his financial records, arguing that the claims have already been rejected by other courts, while emphasizing that their investigation extends beyond hush-money payments.

item.title: Why do some people get sick and even die from Covid-19, while similar people show no symptoms?
item.description: We're now more than seven months into the coronavirus pandemic that has upended the lives of most of Earth's inhabitants. And while it is true that the scientific community has learned many things about the SARS-CoV-2 virus and the disease it causes, Covid-19, there are also many gaps in our understanding.

item.title: Teacher says she may have signed her own death warrant when she voted for Trump in 2016
The UK's troubled coronavirus response becomes more complicated
260 employees in one school district have tested positive for Covid-19 or been exposed
item.description: Georgia's largest school district has confirmed that around 260 employees have either tested positive for Covid-19 or have been exposed.

item.title: Federal judge whose family was attacked by gunman details her son's last words
item.description: The federal judge whose son was killed and whose husband was shot at their New Jersey home last month called for greater privacy protections for judges in her first comments since the shooting.

item.title: South Korean authorities encourage men to marry foreign women. But they often become victims of abuse
item.description: Trinh met her murderer through a matchmaker.

item.title: The US food system is killing Americans
item.description: This global pandemic has given a new meaning to the idea of American exceptionalism. The United States is faring far worse than other countries and shoulders a disproportionate share of global disease burden -- with 4% of the global population, yet, at the time of writing, nearly a quarter of global Covid-19 fatalities.

item.title: One of America's most storied brands is no more
item.description: Sprint was a storied American brand, but it is no longer. T-Mobile, which closed its $30 billion merger with the wireless carrier in April, officially retired the Sprint brand Monday.

item.title: Hotel occupancy rates in Paris are down 86%
item.description: Hotel occupancy rates in Paris are down 86% compared to last year. CNN's Melissa Bell explains the severe impact Covid-19 has had on tourism in the city.

item.title: He's probably been in more movies than any actor in history
item.description: James Hong is everywhere.

item.title: This is how American police gear up to respond to protests
Miles O'Brien explains benefits of a SpaceX water landing
item.description: The SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule splashed down off of Pensacola Beach, Florida, after returning from the International Space Station with astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley aboard in a joint operation between SpaceX and NASA.

item.title: Boko Haram grenade attack kills 15 in north Cameroon
item.description: A grenade exploded in a camp for internally displaced people (IDP) killing 15 and wounding five in an attack on Sunday morning, a local official told CNN.

item.title: Another fake Pelosi video goes viral on Facebook
item.description: Facebook's fact-checkers on Sunday labeled as "partly false" a video that it said was manipulated to make it appear as if House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was drunk or drugged. The video had been circulating on Facebook since Thursday and by Sunday night had been viewed more than 2 million times.

item.title: US election poll: Analyst says this is the latest sign that Trump is in trouble
item.description: CNN analyst Harry Enten explains recent polling that shows some historically Republican states could be more competitive leading into the 2020 presidential election, and other factors that could make President Donald Trump's reelection challenging.

item.title: Robotics startup invents smart mask that translates into eight languages
item.description: When the Covid-19 pandemic made face masks an everyday essential, Japanese startup Donut Robotics spotted an opportunity. They created a smart mask — a high-tech upgrade to standard face coverings, designed to make communication and social distancing easier.

item.title: Eaten water beetles stay alive by escaping through the predator's anus
item.description: Because of their small size, water beetles might have been kicked around since they were born — but thanks to abnormal survival strategies, they're "stayin' alive" after predators eat them.

item.title: North Korea claims it already has vaccine in clinical trials
item.description: North Korea claims that it is developing a vaccine for Covid-19 as state media maintains that the country is still "virus free." CNN's Will Ripley reports

item.title: Former Pope Benedict recovering from 'painful but not serious condition'
item.description: Former Pope Benedict is recovering from a "painful but not serious condition," the Vatican has said, following reports in a German newspaper claiming he was very ill with shingles.

item.title: Israel Folau remains standing as other players take a knee on Super League's return
item.description: Rugby league star Israel Folau's decision not to take a knee before a game should be respected as a "personal choice," says Catalans Dragons coach Steve McNamara.

item.title: Military identifies sailor and 7 Marines in deadly training accident off California coast
item.description: The military has identified the people presumed dead in an amphibious assault vehicle training accident off Southern California last week.

item.title: China's factories are growing at the strongest pace in nearly a decade
Mexico now has third-highest global Covid-19 death toll
item.description: Mexico now has the third-highest global Covid-19 death toll behind the US and Brazil. CNN's Matt Rivers reports from Tijuana, Mexico.

item.title: A 28-year-old woman is the first Covid-19 survivor to receive a double-lung transplant in the US
item.description: Mayra Ramirez says she was careful about following every health precaution she could before the day she was admitted to a Chicago hospital with coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: FDA's list of dangerous hand sanitizers grows to more than 100
item.description: The US Food and Drug Administration has expanded its warning about hand sanitizers to avoid, with the list now topping 100.

item.title: Witness describes hearing moment of Alaska plane collision
item.description: Two small planes collided in the air in Alaska on Friday, killing all seven people on both aircraft, including a state representative from the area, state troopers said.

item.title: Virgin Galactic reveals new supersonic jet design that would fly three times speed of sound
item.description: Virgin Galactic is still aiming to send tourists to space, but the space tourism company is also looking at how to whiz people across our planet as quickly as possible.

item.title: Amazing travel photos from the year we couldn't travel
item.description: It's been a year like no other. As we began 2020, travelers had more freedom of movement than at any time in history. Air traffic had been rising for decades.

item.title: Michelin-starred meals to your door: How fine dining pivoted for the pandemic
item.description: With panoramic views of Singapore's marina and fresh seafood flown in from Hokkaido, Japan, the two-Michelin-starred restaurant Saint Pierre oozes luxury. But when the pandemic hit and Singapore announced its lockdown, the restaurant's future was thrown into doubt.

item.title: How family, fight and fortune fashioned India's very own sporting 'Wonder Woman'
item.description: Imagine being cut off from reality. Not for a day, a week, a month -- but three months. Welcome to P. V. Sindhu's world in 2016.

item.title: Beyoncé drops new visual album
item.description: The 24-time Grammy Award-winning artist has released her hotly anticipated visual album "Black Is King," inspired by "The Lion King," on Disney+.

item.title: One of the most iconic ads in history is back
item.description: One of the most iconic questions in advertising history is back.

item.title: New bridge in Genoa to be inaugurated two years after tragedy
item.description: A new bridge will be inaugurated in the Italian city of Genoa on Monday, two years after 43 people died when the previous structure collapsed.

item.title: Yoenis Céspedes has opted out of MLB season for 'Covid-related reasons' after mysteriously disappearing before Mets game
item.description: New York Mets outfielder Yoenis Céspedes decided to opt out of the MLB season "for Covid-related reasons" after he did not report to the ballpark for Sunday's game in Atlanta, according to the team's general manager Brodie Van Wagenen.

item.title: Hear from 12-year-old that spoke at John Lewis' funeral
item.description: Tybre Faw, who befriended civil rights icon John Lewis, talks to CNN's Don Lemon about speaking at Lewis' funeral in Atlanta.

item.title: Bodycam footage shows horse rescued from burning barn
item.description: Bodycam video filmed as police run into a burning barn shows them save a horse in a moment one officer described as being "quickly improvised." CNN affiliate KYW reports.

item.title: The President blasts the coordinator of the coronavirus task force after she warned the pandemic is 'extraordinarily widespread' in the US
item.description: President Donald Trump criticized Dr. Deborah Birx in a Monday tweet after she warned the pandemic is "extraordinarily widespread" in the US.

item.title: UK's troubled Covid-19 response got more complicated
item.description: The UK's troubled response to the coronavirus pandemic became even more confused on Monday, as government guidance seemingly at odds with itself rolled out across England, pushing the four nations of the UK further apart.

item.title: UK to get 90-minute tests that detect Covid-19 and other viruses
item.description: The British government has procured "millions" of two separate coronavirus tests that can detect not only coronavirus but several other viruses common in autumn, winter and spring, the UK's Department of Health said Monday.

item.title: Teacher: I may have signed death warrant by voting for Trump
item.description: Nancy Shively, an Oklahoma teacher, voted for Trump in 2016. Now, amid a heated debate on reopening schools and watching his response to the pandemic, she says she fears for her life.

item.title: Pandemic enters new phase in US as Trump plays golf
item.description: • Australia imposes strict new virus measures in Victoria as early successes unravel • Latest on Covid-19: 'Major incident' declared in Manchester, UK • Amit Shah tests positive for Covid-19 • The Rock's Netflix film will resume shooting in 'quarantined bubble'

item.title: WHO: Virus having 'negative impact' on global healthcare
Why Covid-19 mutation might not be as dangerous as you think
item.description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta explains how viruses mutate and why we needn't always be worried when they do.

item.title: Spain's former king to leave country amid scrutiny of alleged financial dealings
item.description: • Read former Spanish King Juan Carlos' letter to his son
